items.summary: arXiv:2602.12303v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Over the past few years, Astrophysics has experienced an unprecedented increase in research output, as is evident from the year-over-year increase in the number of research papers put onto the arXiv. As a result, keeping up with pro…

items.title: GAMERA-OP: A three-dimensional finite-volume MHD solver for orthogonal curvilinear geometries
items.summary: arXiv:2602.12307v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present GAMERA-OP (Orthogonal-Plus), a three-dimensional finite-volume magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver for orthogonal curvilinear geometries. The solver advances magnetic fields using constrained transport to preserve $\nabla\!…

items.title: What Suppresses Star Formation in Bulge-Dominated Early-Type Galaxies?
items.summary: arXiv:2602.12324v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We investigate the physical origin of star formation suppression in gas-rich early-type galaxies using five high-resolution hydrodynamical idealized galaxy simulations, performed with the moving-mesh code AREPO. These simulations in…

items.title: Direct pathway to the Early Supermassive Black Holes: A Red Super-Eddington Quasar in a Massive Starburst Host at $z=7.2$
items.summary: arXiv:2602.12325v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a panchromatic optical-mm characterization of GNz7q, a recently identified X-ray weak, rapidly growing red quasar embedded within a dusty starburst galaxy at $z=7.1899$, using the full suite of JWST/NIRCam, NIRSpec, MIRI,…

items.title: Unraveling the Origin of Unequal Mass Gravitational Wave Events: Insights from a Galactic High Mass X-ray Binary
